solution_line_template: First find the area of one side of a roof: {side_length_1} feet * {side_length_2} feet = <<{side_length_1}*{side_length_2}={area_one_side}>>{area_one_side} square feet
Then multiply that number by {sides_per_roof} to find the total area of both sides of the roof: {area_one_side} square feet/side * {sides_per_roof} sides = {area_one_roof} square feet
Then multiply that number by the number of roofs to find the total area of all the roofs: {area_one_roof} square feet/roof * {num_roofs} roofs = {total_area} square feet

Then multiply the total area of the roofs by the number of shingles needed per square foot to find the total number of shingles needed: {total_area} square feet * {shingles_per_sqft} singles/square foot = <<{total_area}*{shingles_per_sqft}={total_shingles}>>{total_shingles} shingles
